follow_shad_galley: ^Shad is still in the Galley, sleeves rolled up and furiously chopping herbs like they owe him money.
^The air is thick with the leftover tension...and fermented horseradish. Definitely horseradish.
^"That banana really caused quite the issue, huh?"
^"He called it gastrointestinal sabotage. Like I was trying to kill everyone off by adding flavour to the dish."
^"To be fair, it did smell like a fusion of a musty landfill and spice market."
^"I was trying to give people something new, something joyful. But apparently joy is off the menu now."
^He tosses a sprig of parsley into the wastebin and sighs.

s: ^"It was a bold move, though. Maybe wait until after the kraken?"
^"Let’s just admit it was cursed and move on."

shad_q1_softcrit: ^"Some risks are worth taking, but maybe not this one."
^"I guess that makes sense. It just...kinda sucks, y'know? I only wanted to help."
shad_q1_support: ^"He probably wanted something sage. You were trying to lift spirits, though. That's never the wrong choice."
^"Exactly! The crews terrified, heck I sure know I am. But food can help say things words can't."
^"And I've never been one to word things correctly, I show it through acts of kindness and put my feelings into the meal I make. I know if people just gave it a chance it would get through to them."
shad_q1_joke: ^"It sure smelt haunted, but hey at least it was memorable."
^"Infamous dishes are a form of both legacy and delicacy."
^"Let the kraken be the legacy and save the delicacies for after our victory."
^"It's best practise not to experiment during battle prep."
shad_q2_intro: ^"I'm not actually scared of Master Porthole, y'know. I'm scared of what comes next."
^"It's not just the kraken. It's also not knowing - I've never been in this position before. I feel like a fish out of water."
^"I just...I've never been a part of a sea battle. Let alone with the Kraken it's all so new to me."

s: ^"It’s okay to admit you’re scared. We all are."
^"You know what I do when I’m scared? Panic. Highly effective."

shad_q2_empathy: ^"It's not a weakness to feel things. You just happen to feel things through...carbs and apparently fermented ingredients."
^"I knew there was a reason I liked you."
^"You know, I don't think fermented foods are all that bad. I guess you could say, I'm cultured."
^"Yes, let that romaine in the past."
shad_q2_push: ^"Fear is fine. Freezing isn't. If you mess up I wont hesitate to drop liabilities."
^"If I was a chef, I wouldn't be a sous chef."
shad_q2_joke: ^"Jokes aside, when i'm scared I just pretend to be invincible. It's gotten me through everything thus far."
^"You think I'm a captain just by chance?"
^"I have to be able to ease the nerves of my crew and rough the waves, if I can't do any of that - I don't deserve this title."
^"Alright I'll try it. It might not be foolproof but if you've gone as far as to give me advice, I'll try my best to make it work."
shad_q3_intro: ^, there's something I haven't told anyone yet."
^He opens a bottle and gently unfurls a half faded piece of parchment.
^"My Great Gram-Gram once made a dish so good it made a navy general weep. She never shared it with anyone but sent the recipe in a bottle out to sea."
^"I-I came upon this a few months ago and I think it might be hers. It's heavily faded but it feels like home, like family,"
^"I've been trying to recreate it from scraps and guessing. All my experiments, even the banana from earlier are me trying to make this."
^"It sounds like a culinary treasure hunt to me"
^"Exactly, and I want to make it real again. Before... there's no one left to remember her cooking."

s: ^"That’s kind of beautiful. I’d like to taste it too."
^"You’re chasing food ghosts. Focus on what’s in front of you."
^"Maybe leave the banana out next time, yeah?"

shad_q3_flirtylead: ^"But then again, I'd try anything you made. Even if it kills me."
^"Tempting me with loyalty and mild recklessness? Careful, Cap'n
^ - I fall hard for that combo."
^"But can't have you croaking out on me just yet - I got a whole lotta recipes I'd love for you to try."
shad_q3_disinterestedlead: ^"It's a nice goal, but right now - we need you grounded. No distractions."
^"Right, Food is just fuel. I get it."
^"There's times for dreams, but right now you have to face reality."
^"Yup, i'll just put this on hold."
shad_q3_neutrallead: ^"Or...tweak the ratios. The idea's got heart, but the execution needs a little work."
^"Oh! Heart and horseradish - why didn't I think of that."
^"Hmm how do you ferment beef heart safely, wait doesn't cooking kill all the bad stuff anyways - should be fine!"
shad_q4_intro: ^He leans back, finally breathing a little easier.
^"So what do you think Cap'n - can I one day achieve this?"

s: ^"I believe in your dream. Just don’t forget to survive first."
^"I respect your passion. But I don’t think I’m the one to encourage it."

shad_exit_flirty: ^"When this is all over, maybe I'll make you be the first to taste it - privately of course."
^"No, somewhere quieter. Candlelights and possible missing shirts."
^He smirks and continues to stir the pots.
^As I turn to leave, something new catches my eye near the spice rack.
shad_exit_disinterested: ^"Right. Dreams are a luxury. Got it."
^"I’ll get back to stirring. You go command stuff."
^Before I can say more, he turns away and grabs another pot.
^My eyes catch something new as I'm leaving.
